title.narrative: CO-Fair Finance Asia - Sida - Cambodia P

description.narrative:
The Fair Finance Asia Program (FFA) envisages to reduce the negative impact of national and cross-border bank investments in Asia on human rights, the environment and climate change, and to increase adequate financial services for pro-poor, inclusive economic development. The goal is to establish a sustainable financial sector in Asia, with financial sector institutions operating at national and regional level being more transparent and accountable and adhering to Economic, Social and Governance (ESG)-criteria. FFA is funded by SIDA.
Cambodia program will be implemented by Oxfam, country office in Cambodia. Fair Finance Cambodia aims to work with stakeholders to strengthen a sustainable financial sector in Cambodia that cares for the social and environmental well-being of all Cambodian people.
To realize the above FFC's aim, FFC will focus on engaging with stakeholders to create a self-sustained mechanism for responsible financial sector through the following approaches/strategies:
1. StrengthenCSOs' capacity in contributing to the promotion of responsible finance 2. Facilitate awareness raisin among the public on responsible finance 3. Increase awareness and political will among government agencies, regulators, banks and banking associationsto be more adherence to responsible and sustainable finance standards. 4. Support key stakeholders to assume leadership in developing appropriate policies and regulatory initiatives thatwill improve social and environmental performance of banks. 5. Facilitate a CSO and private sector- led platform on Cambodia#s Financial Outlook and Prosperity that brings together influencers, investors, decision makers and affected communities to build common understanding.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project#s implementation.

description.narrative: Improved policies Governments and global actors: # cases (sub)national governments or global actors adopting and/or implementing improved gender sensitive policies on promotion of a transparent, accountable and inclusive financial sector.
cases (sub)national governments or global actors adopting and/or implementing improved gender sensitive policies on promotion of a transparent, accountable and inclusive financial sector -DD2

comment.narrative: On June 29, 2021, the Ministry of Environment (MoE) issued number of Prakas on Procedure and Implementation of Guidelines for Initial Report of Environmental and Social Impact Assessment in various sectors. This is to reenforce the sub-decree on the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) requirements for all investment projects

description.narrative: Improved policies Governments and global actors: # cases (sub)national governments or global actors adopting and/or implementing improved gender sensitive policies on promotion of a transparent, accountable and inclusive financial sector.
pieces of evidence (documents, studies, videos, testimonies etc.) produced by Oxfam Novib and partners in support of development/adoption of alternative policies/approaches

comment.narrative: 1)- Policy Paper on Cross-border Investment in Agriculture 2)- Policy Brief on the Compliance of ESIA in Finance and Banking Sector in Cambodia 3)- Policy Brief of Impact of Foreign Direct Investment and China Belt Road Initiative – The Case of Cambodia • On September 22, 2021, FFC coalition members attended the 3rd Sustainable Finance Forum of ABC. The forum was about the sustainable finance with ESG requirements. IFC representative presented their Performance Standards related to environmental and social risks for banks. IFC continued to leverage its investment and capacity building to support all investees to adopt international risk management, corporate governance, and environmental and social standards to improve operations and attract more capital. FFC coalition members asked ABC for putting their Cambodia Sustainable Finance Principles as mandatory requirement for its members and FFC also questioned about the role of NBC on their regulatory framework to support on the implementation of Cambodia Sustainable Finance Principles.

comment.narrative: FFC launched two study reports in a dissemination workshop for 1) Study on Cross-border Investment in Agriculture and 2) Study on Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) Compliance in Cambodian Finance and Banking. Due to COVID-19 restrictions,the launching event was organized virtually with 105 participants (28 females). The participants were: 41 from NGOs, 3 from the Government ministries (including 1 from NBC, 1 from Ministry of Environment, 1 from Ministry of Interior), 3 from ADB, 1 from Chip Mong Bank.

comment.narrative:
Coalition members+ observer members of FFC
7 CSOs joined as Fair Finance Cambodia coalition members: ActionAid Cambodia (AAC), Cooperation Committee for Cambodia (CCC), The NGO Forum on Cambodia (NGOF), Oxfam in Cambodia, Transparency International Cambodia, and as observer roles for SILAKA and UNOHCHR.

comment.narrative: 1 strategic framework development workshop. 1 meeting with SERC about the study on green financing policy implementation in Cambodia. 1 meeting with the Ministry of Economy and Finance (MEF) about the study on green financing policy implementation in Cambodia. 2 meeting with NBC on exploring cooperation and collaboration opportunities. 4 meetings with Cambodia Partnership for Sustainable Agriculture (CPSA) on expanding FFC alliance. 3 meetings with Asia Vision Institute (AVI)’s team about potential collaborations on co-organizing series of dialogues on ESG, green and sustainable finance, framework and policies on CSDG.
